title: Chocolate Lava Cake
description: Decadent individual chocolate cakes with a molten chocolate center that flows out when you cut into them. Perfect for impressing dinner guests!

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Butter four 6-ounce ramekins and dust with cocoa powder, tapping out excess.
Melt chocolate and butter together in a double boiler or microwave, stirring until smooth. Let cool slightly.
In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, egg yolks, sugar, and vanilla until thick and pale, about 2 minutes.
Fold the chocolate mixture into the egg mixture. Gently fold in the flour until just combined.
Divide batter evenly among prepared ramekins. Place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 12-14 minutes until edges are firm but center is soft. Let stand for 1 minute, then invert onto plates. Serve immediately with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

notes: The key to a perfect molten center is not overbaking. The edges should be set but the center should still jiggle slightly.
Use high-quality chocolate (70% cocoa) for the best flavor and texture.
These can be prepared ahead and refrigerated for up to 24 hours. Add 1-2 minutes to baking time if baking from cold.
Dust with powdered sugar just before serving for an elegant presentation.

faqs.question: Can I make these in advance?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can prepare the batter and fill the ramekins up to 24 hours ahead. Keep refrigerated and add 1-2 minutes to the baking time.

faqs.question: What if I don't have ramekins?
faqs.answer: You can use muffin tins instead, but reduce the baking time to 8-10 minutes and watch carefully for doneness.

faqs.question: How do I know when they're done?
faqs.answer: The edges should be firm and slightly pulling away from the sides, but the center should still look soft and jiggle when gently shaken.
